item.title: Help with doors
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“Mrquarter, post:4, topic:40358”]I found your error!
Make this:

public void opend1() { //OPEN 1ST DOOR ON TUT ISLAND deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } public void opend2() { //CLOSE 1st oor on tut island deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }

Make that say this:

public void opend1 { deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } public void opend2 { deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }
Before the //TEXT was stopping the void from happening because it had //[/quote]

You don’t know any Java at all, do you?
You can’t have a method call without specifying the parameters or lack thereof.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with doors
item.dc:creator: @1337_king 1337 king
item.description:
@1337_king wrote:

Mrquarter:

I don’t think objects can do voids. That might be your problem.

I tried that now, but it didnt work. i didnt get error when i compiled, but also didnt work.
oh my god i cant make a door! =([br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 01:01:08 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone else help me?
This problem is starting to get annoying.:([br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 04:04:24 PM[/size][hr]I tried again, with a different mode:

if(objectX == 3097 && objectY == 3107 && objectID == 11616)//closed door { ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,11617, -1); } if(objectX == 3097 && objectY == 3107 && objectID == 11617)//opened door { ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,11616, -2); }

BUT IT STILL DIDNT WORK OH MY GOD!!!
Somehow when i try to make things like click on something, and something happens, dont work!!! But i DO have some of these working, like banking, but those were in the source originally!! Dialogues dont work either!!!

Can someone tell my what the %!/%(=/!"+%Ü(+=%)"(+ Is going on with my server?![br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 05:46:22 PM[/size][hr]Can any1 help me? pLz?!?!?!
whats wrong with my server

1337legend:

u peaice of shit copyed my name !!! =o

hes talking about my name. no i did not copy it. my name is 1337 KING not 1337 Legend:P[br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 11:54:29 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Mrquarter, post:4, topic:40358”]I found your error!
Make this:

public void opend1() { //OPEN 1ST DOOR ON TUT ISLAND deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } public void opend2() { //CLOSE 1st oor on tut island deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }

Make that say this:

public void opend1 { deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } public void opend2 { deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }
Before the //TEXT was stopping the void from happening because it had //[/quote]
No, because // only does a comment for the rest of the line, not the rest of the scripts, till i close it, like /* and */

still not working boo hoo =’([br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 11:57:26 AM[/size][hr]Edit:
I’ve looked for other WORKING scripts like this, i found the banking script, it was just like mine.

So there must be something extra that make this work, somewhere. Because if i make it perfect, why wouldnt it work?? OMG!!

@1337_king wrote:

Mrquarter:

On the first one, you do not put opend1() you just put opend1. Try deleting the () in the first ones where it says public void ()

But then i get the error ‘(’ expected. Where do i put that then?
only 1 error

Edit:
I also tried without useing voids:

if (objectID == 11616) { //tut island #1 door deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } if (objectID == 11617) { //tut island #1 door deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }[br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 10:49:24 AM[/size][hr]answer pls? :D[br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 11:30:39 AM[/size][hr]Cmon, i see u r online.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2006, 11:40:14 AM[/size][hr]pretty pl0x with cheese on top

item.title: Help with doors
item.dc:creator: @1337_king 1337 king
item.description:
@1337_king wrote:

Hi.

I’m making tutorial island on my server, and i need to fix the doors, so they would open, and close.
Everything seems fine, i compile it, but it just won’t work!=(

Here’s my script:
I’ve put 2 voids in the right place:

public void opend1() { //OPEN 1ST DOOR ON TUT ISLAND deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11617, -1, 0); } public void opend2() { //CLOSE 1st oor on tut island deletethatobject(3097, 3107); makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 11616, -1, 0); }
These voids make the door close, and open.(#11616 object? its a tropical wooden door made from planks, yeah its not the best for tut island, but i cant get a world objects list from anywhere.=( )

I’ve deleted the door there was originally.

I made these scripts in the right place too:

if (objectID == 11616) { //tut island #1 door opend1(); } if (objectID == 11617) { //tut island #1 door opend2(); }
this code is for activating the voids.

Everything seems fine, but when i test it, there is the door, but when i try to open it, nothing happens.

Can some1 help me?

Read full topic
